This was not in my list of three but it is easier to send....

ExtractorUniversal.java contains the following check

  protected void innerProcess(CrawlURI curi) {
         if(curi.hasBeenLinkExtracted()){
             //Some other extractor already handled this one. We'll pass on it.
             return;
         }

I think all the extractors should have the same or similar code.  Right now 
it is not easy to prevent a curi from having its links followed.  I cant 
find anywhere in the standard code where this is checked other than the one 
place in ExtractorUniversal.

An example of how this might be useful would be someone who is doing 
lexical analysis on documents as they are being fetched.  Depending upon 
the content of document, they might wish to discontinue following the thread.
